summary: Wasps appealed against the three-match ban imposed on Hughes for his elbow on North's head Hughes was sent off and then banned for three weeks following the incident on March 27 Hughes was sent off and then banned for three weeks following the incident on March 27 Hughes was sent off and then banned for three weeks following the incident on March 27 Hughes was sent off and then banned for three weeks following the incident on March 27
aspect: Nathan Hughes' ban for accidentally knocking out George North was overturned on appeal due to an outcry from his supporters. Hughes, who missed his side's Champions Cup match last Sunday, is now free to return to action immediately after the ban was thrown out.
explain: Nathan Hughes' three-match ban has been overturned due to an appeal from his supporters, resulting in his immediate return to action, as the ban was initially imposed on him for inadvertently kneeing George North in the head.
